data.title: Landing with a parachute
data.statement:
Check if the person with a parachute can land between the trees. The person goes with the air flowing from left to right, and can be placed anywhere in the sky in the beginning!

The person can land between the trees if the distance from the gap in the ground ({{~}} characters on the last line) is equals to the height of the person, and the person will not hit a tree on its way there.

<<Distance can be calculated by simply subtracting the index of the gap in the last line, and the index of the person in the air vertically>>

Height can vary, depending on the height of the trees (trees could be stacked).

<<Example>>
(distance is 2 in this case)
o~~~ =>  ~~~~ => ~~~~
~~~~ =>  ~o~~ => ~~~~ => {{Land}}
TT~T =>  TT~T => TToT

testCases.title: More empty space in the ground

data.constraints:
0  < [[N]] < 10
There is no invalid input! The person will never go outside of the map
data.stubGenerator:
read N:int

loop N read line:string(10)

write Answer
data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1:>> An Integer [[N]] for the number of lines
<<Next [[N]] lines:>> {{o}}, {{~}} or {{T}} characters, where the {{o}} is the person, {{~}} is air/ground, {{T}} is a tree.
data.outputDescription:
{{Big tree}} - If the person hits a tree higher than 1
{{Tree}} - If the person hits a tree with 1 height
{{Land}} - If the person can land

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

Check if the person with a parachute can land between the trees. The person goes with the air flowing from left to right, and can be placed anywhere in the sky in the beginning!

The person can land between the trees if the distance from the gap in the ground (~ characters on the last line) is equals to the height of the person, and the person will not hit a tree on its way there.

Distance can be calculated by simply subtracting the index of the gap in the last line, and the index of the person in the air vertically

Height can vary, depending on the height of the trees (trees could be stacked).

Example
(distance is 2 in this case)
o~~~ => ~~~~ => ~~~~
~~~~ => ~o~~ => ~~~~ => Land
TT~T => TT~T => TToT
Input
Line 1: An Integer N for the number of lines
Next N lines: o, ~ or T characters, where the o is the person, ~ is air/ground, T is a tree.
Output
Big tree - If the person hits a tree higher than 1
Tree - If the person hits a tree with 1 height
Land - If the person can land
Constraints
0 < N < 10
There is no invalid input! The person will never go outside of the map
Example
Input
3
o~~~
~~~~
TT~T
Output
Land
